item.title: Schokoban: Using Monte Carlo Tree Search for Solving Sokoban
item.description: In my Bachelor’s thesis, under the supervision of Professor Dr. Peters, I explored the application of Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) to the puzzle game Sokoban. Sokoban challenges players to push boxes onto designated targets within a warehouse, becoming increasingly complex as the game progresses. My thesis presents a novel approach to manage redundant state representations within the Monte Carlo Search Tree, significantly enhancing the algorithmâ€™s ability to solve problems. Below is a preview of the comparative results between the standard and improved algorithms.
